intro: Psychotria reducta var. pilosula, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, hairy pubescence. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. This variant is often found in humid, shaded environments within dense tropical forests.
